intro: Roldana tonii, commonly known as the Tonian roldana, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Roldana tonii is typically found in moist, shaded habitats and is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native environment.
